lines.gurmukhi: jYsy bCurw ibllwq mwq imlby kau bMDn kY bis kCu bsu n bswq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Bachhuraa Bilalaat Maat Milabay Kau , Bandhan Kai Basi Kachhu Basu N Basaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a calf writhes and wriggles to meet his mother but tethered with rope makes him helpless.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qau ibgwrI cwhY Bvn gvn kIE pr bis pry icqvq hI ibhwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Bigaaree Chaahai Bhavan Gavan Keeao , Par Basi Paray Chitavat Hee Bihaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a person caught in forced or unpaid labour wants to go home and spends time planning while remaining in other's control.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy ibrhnI piRA sMgm snyhu cwhy lwj kul AMks kY durbl gwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Birahanee Pria Sangam Sanayhu Chaahay , Laaj Kul Ankas Kai Durabal Gaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a wife separated from her husband wants love and union but cannot do so for fear of family shame and thus loses her physical attraction.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur crn srin suK cwhY isKu AwigAw bD rhq ibdys Akulwq hY ]520]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gur Charan Sarani Soukh Chaahai Sikhu , Aagiaa Badh Rahat Bidays Akulaat Hai ?520?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly a true disciple wants to enjoy the pleasures of the refuge of True Guru but bound by his command he wanders around dejectedly in another place.  (520)
